solution_line_template: Liza used {total_butter}/{chocolate_chip_divisor} = <<{total_butter}/{chocolate_chip_divisor}={butter_for_chocolate_chip}>>{butter_for_chocolate_chip} kilograms of butter for the chocolate chip cookies.

Then, she used {total_butter}/{peanut_butter_divisor} = <<{total_butter}/{peanut_butter_divisor}={butter_for_peanut_butter}>>{butter_for_peanut_butter} kilograms of butter for the peanut butter cookies.

She used {butter_for_chocolate_chip} + {butter_for_peanut_butter} = <<{butter_for_chocolate_chip}+{butter_for_peanut_butter}={butter_for_choc_and_pb}>>{butter_for_choc_and_pb} kilograms of butter for the chocolate and peanut butter cookies.
So, only {total_butter} -{butter_for_choc_and_pb} = <<{total_butter}-{butter_for_choc_and_pb}={butter_left_after_choc_and_pb}>>{butter_left_after_choc_and_pb} kilograms of butter was left.

Then, Liza used {butter_left_after_choc_and_pb}/{sugar_cookies_divisor} = <<{butter_left_after_choc_and_pb}/{sugar_cookies_divisor}={butter_for_sugar}>>{butter_for_sugar} kilograms of butter for the sugar cookies.
Therefore, only {butter_left_after_choc_and_pb}-{butter_for_sugar} = <<{butter_left_after_choc_and_pb}-{butter_for_sugar}={butter_left_final}>>{butter_left_final} kilograms of butter were left.
